stream_context.summary: Kaze works on a retro-futuristic ‘space colony’ course (formerly a slide level) while celebrating the public release of Demo 2 (course 1 only). He experiments with trampoline platforms, monorails, rocket geometry, and brainstorms possible bosses.

development_findings.summary: Demo 2, containing only Course 1, was released publicly the same day as the stream.
development_findings.quote: I released the second demo today… Keep in mind the demo is just course one.

development_findings.summary: Course 15 was completely rebuilt; its new aesthetic is 1960s retro-futurism with monorails, satellites, and a climbable rocket.
development_findings.quote: This level has changed a lot since stream last saw it… the theme for this is like retrofuturism, so we want this to look like a space colony as imagined in 1960.

development_findings.summary: Player movement has been nerfed; spin/ground-pound-dive is now a safety move that cancels momentum, and the powerful Z+A move was removed.
development_findings.quote: I keep forgetting I changed it so you can only spin or ground pound dive at any time, because otherwise the movement is too broken.

development_findings.summary: Kaze is prototyping ‘speaker’-style trampoline platforms that launch Mario; he worries the first bounce may shock players and considers using familiar spherical bouncers instead.
Boss brainstorming pivoted from ‘The Blob’ to ‘Sluggy the Unshaven’ and finally toward a gigantic space squid whose tentacles emerge from bright rifts, with eyes that can be attacked.
development_findings.quote: Alright, fuck it. Instead of the blob, it's Sluggy the Unshaven… later: Imagine black holes with tentacles coming out of it all over the level attacking Mario.

development_findings.summary: A performance experiment—executing code directly from cartridge to free the RAM bus—saved CPU time but failed to improve RDP time.
development_findings.quote: My idea was we run the code directly from the cartridge instead of from RAM… Unfortunately it did not and I don't know why.

development_findings.summary: EverDrive X7 units crash because the flashcart leaves RAM uncleared; Kaze compiled a build that explicitly invalidates RAM and is stress-testing it.
development_findings.quote: I found out today that my game does not boot on the EverDrive X7… I'm trying a build where I invalidate the entire RAM before I boot the game.

development_findings.summary: He plans dynamic lights on rifts so players can read tentacle attack telegraphs.
development_findings.quote: The rift could be really bright and we could use dynamic lights to shine light onto Mario so the player knows where the attack is coming from.

development_findings.summary: Performance headroom from custom camera and engine optimizations is being spent on higher-poly environments.
development_findings.quote: Speed gains are mostly spent on like more polygons and details.

context_findings.summary: Kaze openly rejects traditional color theory, calling it ‘bullshit’.
context_findings.quote: I don't even use color theory… I think it's all bullshit.

context_findings.summary: He dislikes social small talk like ‘How are you?’ yet debates Kant’s categorical imperative about politeness.
context_findings.quote: I hate when people ask how are you… according to Kant, should I ask people how they are or should I not?

context_findings.summary: He was uncertain the high-tech demo video would perform well but feels relieved by positive reception.
context_findings.quote: I really wasn't sure if that video would do well at all… so far it seems to be doing well.

context_findings.summary: Stream distractions and chat volume slow his productivity; he chooses to end stream early to manage the demo release.
context_findings.quote: Today is a little bit slow, that's partially because I'm half distracted with all the comments… I think I'm keeping the stream short.

biobak.summary: Provides texture support; Kaze expects Biobak to replace a placeholder speaker texture.
biobak.quote: I'm sure Biobak can find a better texture for what I'm trying to convey.

biobak.summary: Engaged in philosophical banter about Kant with Kaze.

key_stories.title: Demo 2 Launch
key_stories.summary: On stream day, Kaze releases the second public demo limited to Course 1. He monitors feedback, plans a full playthrough upload, and addresses complaints about audio noisiness.
key_stories.challenge: Delivering a stable, enticing slice of the hack to the public.
key_stories.process: Prepared only Course 1, packaged an easy-to-patch ROM, and released it; gathers live feedback.
key_stories.outcome: Positive initial reception; Kaze intends to tweak audio levels and record a showcase video.
key_stories.key_quote: Looks like people somewhat like it… I'm gonna upload a full playthrough of it tomorrow.

key_stories.title: Evolving Boss Concept
key_stories.summary: While designing the space-colony level, Kaze cycles through three boss ideas—The Blob, Sluggy the Unshaven, and a giant space squid with rift-spawned tentacles—seeking a mechanic that feels readable and engaging.
key_stories.challenge: Create a boss that fits the retro-futurist theme and offers clear, fair gameplay.
key_stories.process: Brainstormed movie-inspired ‘blob’, swapped to Yoshi’s Island homage Sluggy, then devised squid with light-signalled tentacle attacks and vulnerable eyes.
key_stories.outcome: Settled (for now) on the squid concept, pending further testing of damage & telegraph clarity.
key_stories.key_quote: Imagine black holes with tentacles coming out of it all over the level attacking Mario.

key_stories.title: EverDrive Boot Bug
key_stories.summary: Physical EverDrive X7 units fail to boot the hack because the flashcart leaves memory dirty.
key_stories.challenge: Make the game run on original hardware with EverDrive.
key_stories.process: Diagnosed that beta cache wasn’t cleared; compiled a special build that invalidates all RAM before boot and left it running for over an hour.
key_stories.outcome: Ongoing stability test; preliminary results look promising.
key_stories.key_quote: Right now I'm trying a build where I invalidate the entire RAM before I boot the game.
